transcription.text: I call this meeting to order. Today is January 15th, 2019. Madam Secretary, please call the roll.
Council Member Adams — present. Council Member Brown — present. Council Member Chen — present. Council Member Davis — absent. Mayor Johnson — present.
A quorum is present. We will proceed. First item: approval of the minutes from the December 18th meeting.
Mayor Johnson, I move that we approve the minutes from the December 18th, 2018 regular meeting as written.
I second the motion.
The motion has been made and seconded to approve the December minutes. All in favour say aye.
Aye.
Aye.
Aye.
Motion carries. Minutes are approved. Next item: proposed amendment to the FY2019 operating budget.

Thank you Mayor Johnson. The Finance Department is requesting an amendment of two hundred and fifty thousand dollars to the public works capital improvements line. We identified unexpected infrastructure needs during the December road inspection — specifically the Oak Street bridge requires immediate structural reinforcement. We have obtained three contractor bids ranging from one hundred eighty thousand to two hundred thirty thousand dollars. We recommend approving the full two-fifty to provide contingency.
Director Kim, where would these funds be drawn from? I want to make sure we are not affecting the parks and recreation budget that we worked hard to protect this year.

Council Member Adams, the funds would come from the general fund reserve. We currently hold nine hundred forty thousand in reserve, well above our mandated minimum of six hundred thousand. This transfer would leave us at six hundred ninety thousand — still compliant and with a reasonable buffer.

I appreciate that clarification. I do want to note for the record that the Oak Street bridge has been flagged in inspection reports going back to 2016. We should discuss why this was not budgeted sooner. But given the safety urgency I will support the amendment.
Duly noted. Council Member Brown's comment is on the record. Is there a motion to approve the budget amendment as presented by the Finance Department?
I move that we approve the transfer of two hundred fifty thousand dollars from the general fund reserve to capital improvements for the Oak Street bridge project.
I second.
Motion made by Council Member Chen, seconded by Council Member Adams. Roll call vote: Adams?
Aye.
Brown?
Aye.
Chen?
Aye.
Davis is absent. Mayor votes aye. Motion carries four to zero with one absence. Budget amendment approved. Director Kim, please coordinate with Public Works to begin the contractor selection process.
Yes, Mayor. We will issue a formal RFP within ten business days.
Thank you. Next item on the agenda: public comment period. We have three speakers signed up. First speaker, please approach the podium and state your name for the record.

summary: City Council regular meeting on January 15, 2019. Mayor Johnson presiding. Quorum present (four of five members; Davis absent). Minutes from December 18 meeting approved unanimously. Budget amendment approved 4-0: $250,000 transfer from general fund reserve to capital improvements for Oak Street bridge structural reinforcement. Finance Director Kim to issue RFP within 10 business days. Council Member Brown noted on record that bridge issues were flagged since 2016.
